intro: Mitropsidium oligospermum, commonly known as the slender leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
